answers.answer: No to the dilation and yes to the girl.Only a manual check by your doctor will be able to determine if you're dilated.  At only 34 weeks though, you don't want to be.  He'll probably begin checking you at your 37-38 week appointments, unless he has some reason to check now.Three ultrasounds after 20 weeks for the gender can be trusted, I'm sure.  Did they show you the three lines that indicated 'girl' while you were having the u/s done?Hang in there, only a few more weeks to go!
An u/s will not show if you are dialated, or ready to give birth. The Dr. will have to check your cervix manually. This can be pretty uncomfortable, so he may not do it unless you ask.
You are so right!  I HATED being checked, it hurt!
Thanks everyone. Another reason I was asking is because last my doctor says I am measuring 37 weeks. So the ultrasound is to measure the baby so I didnt know of that meant I would be dialated or not.

Yeah, don't be in a rush at 34 weeks to want the baby out.  At this point, every added week gives the baby a lot, and you don't want to wish on any child the stress that a preemie goes through.  Do everything you can with your diet to reduce the bloating and discomfort, cut back on salt to nothing, and of course with GD watch the carbs and sugars like a hawk.  It can really help even at this stage of pregnancy, and make you feel a lot better.  Good luck!  Annie

question: Hello everyone. I am 34 weeks along and have an ultrasound scheduled for tomorrow. I am just wondering if it will show if I am dialated any???? I know I still have a while but I have gained so much weight and am so swollen (and have gestational diabetes) I want my baby to come out!!! I am so excited to see her that I can hardly stand it (husband and I have tried for 14 years)!!!!! and finally it happened on its own. Also I have already had 3 ultrasounds since I was 20 weeks and the tech has said everytime that it was a girl do you think it is safe to assume that is what I am having? (I hope so everything is pink)!!!!!!
title: Will an ultrasound show...........
